overview: From 2025-05-15 to 2025-05-16, elizaos/eliza had 20 new PRs (10 merged), 1 new issues, and 22 active contributors.

topIssues.title: I can't get my bot to detect my twitter activity
topIssues.author: FancyFishok
topIssues.body:
I got my bot to log in and make a post using the client on local host, but I can't get it to respond to other tweets using “TWITTER_TARGET” nor does it respond when I mention it with another account

I have already checked that my Cookies are ok and I've successfully installed the plugins

I also tried using Twitter-client in the plugins seccion

I am using the main version

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2a82cafe-1acb-4f26-8991-aa67ec3d1dca)

topIssues.title: chore: Test every command in docs cli section
topIssues.author: madjin
topIssues.body:
Go through every page and test every command for accuracy in the eliza docs, report any issues

https://eliza.how/docs/cli/overview

topPRs.title: feat: add integration tests
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added comprehensive integration tests for all major database operations, including agents, cache, components, embeddings, entities, logs, memories, participants, relationships, rooms, tasks, and worlds.
  - Introduced seed data files to support integration testing scenarios.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved data returned for room and memory queries to include additional fields such as metadata and name.

- **Refactor**
  - Enhanced settings merging logic to deeply merge and allow deletion of nested keys by setting them to null.

- **Chores**
  - Added integration test scripts and updated test environment configuration for easier and more reliable testing.
  - Updated available agents list to only include those with required environment variables.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: add integration tests
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body: this is just a test to bypass runner cache

topPRs.title: chore: update docs
topPRs.author: madjin
topPRs.body:
This PR focuses on a comprehensive update of the project's documentation.

Key changes include:

*   **Content Updates:**
    *   Updated blog posts.
    *   Added brief versions of all partner documentation.
    *   Added documentation for "safe" (details of what "safe" refers to could be added here if known).
    *   Updated the "safe brief".
*   **Format and Structure:**
    *   Converted documentation files to MDX format.
    *   Renamed files and fixed MDX-related issues.
    *   Added README files for various folders to support autodocs.
*   **Fixes:**
    *   Addressed TypeDoc and Docusaurus errors to ensure proper documentation generation.
*   **Branch Management:**
    *   Includes merges from the `v2-develop` branch to keep the documentation branch up-to-date.

This PR aims to improve the clarity, accuracy, and accessibility of our documentation.

Also adds vite-node-polyfills to supplement Buffer and process missing.

completedItems.title: fix: Guarantee onComplete is always called in messageReceivedHandler
completedItems.body:
This PR ensures the onComplete callback is always executed, regardless of whether the message handler completes successfully, throws an error, or times out.

Key changes:
- Wrapped the entire messageReceivedHandler logic in a try-finally
